intro: Arabis oxyphylla, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Arabis oxyphylla thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in sunny, well-drained environments. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to arid and coastal climates.
